abstract: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on software for the iPhone and its other devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow.
snippet: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on software for the iPhone and its other devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow.
lead_paragraph: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow.

headline.main: Apple Places New Limits on App Developers
headline.print_headline: Trying to Stay Out Front, Apple Places New Limits on App Developers

abstract: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow, The New York Times’s Jenna Wortham reported.

headline.main: Apple Places New Limits on App Developers

abstract: Opera said it would give away its Opera Mini browser, which compresses Internet data for faster surfing.
snippet: Opera said it would give away its Opera Mini browser, which compresses Internet data for faster surfing.
lead_paragraph: The Norwegian company that makes the Opera Internet browser said on Tuesday that its software had been approved for use on the iPhone, making it the first browser that competes with Apple’s own software to gain full access to the device.

headline.main: Apple Lets Opera Browser Use Own Software on iPhone
headline.print_headline: Apple Lets Opera Browser Use Own Software on iPhone
